channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-16081] Replication remove_peer gets stuck and blocks WAL rolling
item.description:
We use a blocking take from CompletionService in HBaseInterClusterReplicationEndpoint. When we remove a peer, we try to shut down all threads gracefully. But, under certain race condition, the underlying executor gets shutdown and the CompletionService#take will block forever, which means the remove_peer call will never gracefully finish.
Since ReplicationSourceManager#removePeer and ReplicationSourceManager#recordLog lock on the same object, we are not able to roll WALs in such a situation and will end up with gigantic WALs.
item.summary: Replication remove_peer gets stuck and blocks WAL rolling

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Please describe the whole deadlock in the code. Forcing people to read from two places means that the info won't be read by many.
Attached a new patch that uses an await and log.error instead of polling as we discussed Elliott Clark

I can neither recreate TestMasterReplication nor TestMasterFailoverWithProcedures on my personal laptop. Checking the Unit Test logs, these tests seem to have only failed because of timeout. What do you think Elliott Clark, Ashu Pachauri?

Pushed to master, branch-1 and branch-1.3. Thanks for the patch! Test failures appear to be unrelated, but will watch for the builds on stable branches.

cc Sean Busbey

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: When a replication endpoint is sent a shutdown request by the replication source in situations like removing a peer, we now try to gracefully shut it down by draining the items already sent for replication to the peer cluster. If the drain does not complete in the specified time (hbase.rpc.timeout * replication.source.maxterminationmultiplier), the regionserver is aborted to avoid blocking the WAL roll.
